author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: Avery Johnson visits seriously injured Southern football player
text:
Avery Johnson visits seriously injured Southern football player Avery Johnson 10-15-15 Alabama coach Avery Johnson talks Tide preseason practice. 
Alabama coach Avery Johnson spent part of Wednesday visiting injured Southern football player Devon Gales, who suffered several fractures in his neck during a game against Georgia Sept. 26. 
Gales has been rehabbing in the spinal cord program at Atlanta's Shepherd Center. Shout out 2 @CoachAvery6 4 visiting me @ShepherdCenter 2day during lunch. Awesome guy & a Jaguar 4 life! Thx! #gettingitin #physicaltherapy — Devon J. Gales (@IAmDevonGales) October 14, 2015 
Johnson — who played basketball at Southern from 1986-88 — was in town for a recruiting trip. 
Knowing he would be in the area, Johnson called Southern athletic director Roman Banks to ask if he could visit Gales. 
"I don't want to get emotional. I think he did more for me than I did for him," Johnson said following Alabama's open practice Thursday night . "His attitude was so great. He's making progress in his rehab. His mom and his entire family was there. And I'm glad he lifted my spirits about life. He thought I lifted his spirits. He's got a long road ahead. But every day, he's gaining a yard, he's gaining a yard. And I believe one day he's gonna walk again."
